title: Foran green-light for NRL comeback
text:
Kieran Foran NRL comeback: NZ Warriors star cleared by league, Round 3 return vs Dogs possible Staff writers, FOX SPORTS March 11, 2017 10:43am 
KIERAN Foran could make his NRL comeback next weekend after the troubled star was cleared by the league to return with the New Zealand Warriors. 
An NRL statement on Saturday said that Foran had been given final approval to be registered with his new club, which he joined after an ill-fated stint at Parramatta. 
An NRL spokesman said the decision had been made after the league received a final psychological assessment of the Kiwi Test playmaker. 
“In making our determination we have taken into account a range of factors including Kieran’s physical and mental well being as well as behavioural issues,” the spokesman said. 
“Kieran has made it clear to the NRL that he regrets any actions in the past that may have caused angst to anyone and is thankful to have this chance to resume his career. 
“He has paid a significant financial and personal price for his actions and we believe he should now be allowed to return to the NRL.” media_camera Kieran Foran (L) and Shaun Johnson at the Auckland Nines. 
The Warriors have started the season 1-1, beating Newcastle and losing to Melbourne. The Round 3 clash for which Foran may return is against the Bulldogs on Friday night at Forsyth Barr Stadium in Dunedin - a Dogs home game that the club elected to take to New Zealand. 
Ata Hingano played five-eighth alongside halfback Shaun Johnson in the Warriors’ last start - a 26-10 defeat to the Storm on Friday night.
